page.title: 02Farming in the Leewood area
page.content:
Farming in this area is varied. A survey found the following activities: dairy and beef cattle,sheep,poultry, pigs,cereals and potatoes. Cattle are mainly Friesians or Herefords. Some farms have sheep which they own thoughout the year,but other farms have tack sheep which are brought down from the mountains near Bala in winter and kept on the farm for six months. Some farms own horses for riding. The cereals grown include barley and oats. Many fields produce silage and hay. A minority of farms have poultry, while others breed pheasant and trout for sportsmen.
